comment.body: Thanks. Removed.

Ah right, I forgot about DNS blocking. Not sure how to solve it with DNS blocking. 

For some reasons, I can't reproduce the issue now (there's no `youborafds01.com`, not sure if it's because of different US IP addresses or not). 

If I remember correctly, the `a-fds.youborafds01.com/data?` connection's response returns `youboranqs01.com` domain which is used as a domain for next connections. If `a-fds.youborafds01.com/data?` is blocked, the connection will have `undefined` as a domain which would create a loop of invalid connections.

---

> `https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-04-14/etsy-artisans-shoppers-poised-for-pain-as-tariff-loophole-ends?embedded-checkout=true`

This link works fine for me without exceptions though. In fact the only issue I saw with `a-fds.youborafds01.com` is with `pluto.tv`, including in uBO's issue threads.

@AdamWr Sorry, can you reproduce the issue?

comment.body:
I tried

```adb
niyogbd.xyz#@#div[id^="div-gpt-"]
niyogbd.xyz#@#ins.adsbygoogle[data-ad-slot]
#@#ins.adsbygoogle[data-ad-slot]
#@#div[id^="div-gpt-"]
@@||niyogbd.xyz^$generichide
```

but the generic cosmetic rules still apply on Firefox:

```adb
##ins.adsbygoogle[data-ad-slot]
##div[id^="div-gpt-"]
```

@AdguardTeam/filters-maintainers Sorry, can anyone check this?

comment.body:
Regarding - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/203347#issue-3001256190
> With the base filtre enabled any click on the shopping does not work

I guess that it may happens only after clicking on some specific links.
Please try to add following rule to user rules:
```adblock
@@||googleadservices.com/pagead/aclk*ohost=*.google.*$document
```

comment.body:
Regarding - `https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-04-14/etsy-artisans-shoppers-poised-for-pain-as-tariff-loophole-ends?embedded-checkout=true`, it's behind paywall and video does not work without ad blocker on my end.
I checked out a different link - `https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2025-04-10/why-trump-unleashed-tariff-chaos-video`, I see that `youborafds01.com` request is blocked but video works correctly.

<hr>

Back to the `pluto.tv`, I can reproduce breakage on this page only on the first visit. It looks like that it spams with `https://undefined/infinity/session/beat?timemark=` request when `youborafds01.com` is blocked and then website breaks.
Maybe we could also add a scriptlet to prevent it?
This:
```adblock
pluto.tv#%#//scriptlet('abort-on-stack-trace', 'Date.prototype.getTime', 'startSessionHeartBeat')
```
seems to works fine on my end. The "aborted" script is inside `try...catch` so it rather should not breaks something and it should not spam with this request.

comment.body:
I cannot reproduce it.
Please try to disable then enable content blockers in Safari settings, restart Safari and check for filters update. Do not close AdGuard window for 30-60 seconds (until update process will be finished).

comment.body:
Известно, что эта проблема решается с помощью AdGuard Extra.

Если вы пользуетесь AdGuard на устройствах Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включена в настройках приложения.

Если вы используете расширение AdGuard для браузера, рекомендуется также установить AdGuard Extra.

* [Установка на браузеры Chrome, Edge или другие, основанные на Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установка на Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

Not reproduced on my end. Enable `Estonian List`.
After that, try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
@zloyden your second rule doesn't work when the Gmail interface is set to a non-English language.

The first rule works across all languages, but when the page loads, the element is visible for hundreds of milliseconds before AdGuard hides it, causing a layout shift. I'm not sure how important that is, but my rule doesn’t have this issue.

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end.
Try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
Maybe it would be better without using extended CSS (`#?#`)?
Something like:
```adblock
mail.google.com##div[role="main"] > div > div[role="region"][aria-label]:has(> div[class] > img[data-sf-original-src*="/drawable-hdpi/gemini-color-"])
```
but I cannot check if it's visible for a moment like mentioned in the comment above, because it's not displayed for my accounts.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.63.2

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/SPY/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. I apologize if reports from uBlock Origin users are not allowed. You have to scroll down and scroll back up on the page to see the banner on the top. 

Adding this filter removes the banner (uBlock Origin format) 

`finance.yahoo.com##.open.yf-b3eslr.topAboveAd.app-banner`

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1aa03916-3648-40f1-b441-c0d5566bb0a1)

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition
